stimulusHtml: The world population growth rate in 2015 is about 1 percent. It is expected to drop to 0.5 percent by 2050, partly because of increased access to birth control in developing nations. Another likely cause for the expected decline is
choicesHtml: a decrease in the spread of pandemic diseases like Ebola
an increase in the total fertility rate in developed nations
an increased global food supply as a result of climate change
increasing numbers of women entering the workforce in developing nations
medical advances that will increase the life spans of people in developing nations
